intro: Struthiolopsis pulvinata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Struthiolopsis pulvinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
